doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 7 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 2/10/1987]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 7 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 2/10/1987]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, Joyce Hunter, and Jim Levin 2. Short news stories3. Updates about the March on Washington, including discussion of the demands of community on governmentCOMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball3. Criticism of GMHC's lack of an active political front, and emphasis on social service in the communityCOMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine4. Gay rights advocate and psychiatrist, Emery Hetrick's obituary5. News Watch, a study by the University of California, Berkeley finds that gay men who only engage in oral sex or insertive anal intercourse have a lower risk of contracting AIDS virus6. Philadelphia, a gay city employee charges the city with violation of its gay rights law by not allowing his lover certain rights7. San Francisco, openly gay Tom Nolan elected President of the San Mateo Board of Supervisors8. People traveling to Mexico to buy experimental AIDS treatment drugs will be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law as drug smugglers9. Warren, Michigan, mayor bans local cable company from airing gay program "The Lambda Report" on its public access channel10. San Francisco, two former members of the satirical protest group, The Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence, register legally as the "official San Francisco 1987 papal welcoming committee"11. Sports ReportCOMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey12. Lavender Health, interview with Stephen Schaefer, coordinator of the AIDS Hotline13. George Trahanis's closing statement14. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff BixbyCOMMERCIAL: The Monster2. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of "Blue is for Boys" and interview with actor, Allen GassmanCOMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs3. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, short news stories4. Judell interviews Canadian comedian, Lorne ElliottCOMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball5. Razor Sharp introduces a contest to win a date with her6. Olivia Negron, closing statements7. Closing credits
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 7 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 2/10/1987]: February 1987
